name: Chyvarloe to Gunwalloe Fishing Cove, Penrose

ai.summary: A coastal 8.5 km moderate hike from Chyvarloe to Gunwalloe Fishing Cove, Penrose. The route offers sea views, varied terrain, and coastal wind exposure, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily coastal path along cliffs and sea walls, with a mix of dirt tracks, grassy sections, and occasional rocky steps. Expect uneven footing, possible mud after rain, and exposed sections with ocean views.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times before starting; stay away from cliff edges; wear sturdy footwear and bring layers for wind and rain; carry water and snacks; be prepared for rapid weather changes along the coast; daylight can be limited in winter; take care near coves and rocky outcrops.
recommended_gear: Mobile phone with full battery and portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; can be done year-round with proper gear.
